analyzed: khemam subhikkham sukha tā ca kāye
translated: Peace, good harvests, and happiness in the body;
Do not be confused when it is destroyed,
Like a broken raft in the middle of the ocean.
The doer of good, the good,
and the doer of evil, the evil;
“This is the word of the teacher,

analyzed: ayam eva saḥ piṅgiya vena sākhaḥ
translated: This is the very same Piṅgīya branch of the bamboo,
on which I killed a thousand nobles;
that suffering has come back to me.

analyzed: sāmā ca kho candana litta gattā
translated: And those who were anointed with sandalwood paste,
like a stick sticking out of a saw,
without seeing the time to die, I will die,

analyzed: tat me itas dukkhataram bhavissati iti
translated: that will be more painful for me than this.”
